summary: An email chain between FBI personnel and former FBI agent Jeffrey Carrie, now a security director at Weill Cornell Medical Center, reporting a conversation he overheard in a New Jersey bar about the Epstein case. Carrie provided photos of two women discussing suspicious details about Epstein's death, including money transfers and alleged BOP employee involvement.

persons.name: Jeffrey Carrie
persons.role: Former FBI Agent, Director of Security & Emergency Management at Weill Cornell Medical Center
persons.context: Former FBI agent who overheard a conversation about the Epstein case at a bar in Montclair, NJ, and reported it to the FBI with photos of the individuals involved.

persons.name: Diego
persons.context: Mentioned as someone Jeffrey Carrie now works for at NYP (likely NewYork-Presbyterian Hospital).

connections.description: Jeffrey Carrie works for Diego at NYP (NewYork-Presbyterian Hospital).
Carrie, a former FBI agent, reported overheard information about the Epstein case to the FBI.

events.title: Conversation Overheard at De Novo Bar
events.description: Jeffrey Carrie and his wife were at the De Novo Bar in Montclair, NJ, where he overheard two women discussing the Epstein case, including claims about money sent to a Swiss bank account after his death and alleged involvement of four BOP employees.

events.title: Email and Photos Sent to FBI
events.description: Jeffrey Carrie sent an email to the FBI with attached photos of the two women he overheard, including one getting into an Acura.

events.title: FBI Internal Email Forwarding Report
events.description: An FBI agent forwarded Jeffrey Carrie's report internally, summarizing the overheard conversation and requesting vetting for connections to the case.

keyFacts: A former FBI agent overheard a conversation in a New Jersey bar where a woman claimed money was sent to a Swiss bank account after Jeffrey Epstein's death.
The same woman alleged that four Bureau of Prisons (BOP) employees were involved and could retire within the next year.
She also stated that procedural errors occurred, including moving Epstein's cellmate out and correctional officers not performing proper checks.
The witness took photos of the two women and the license plate of an Acura they departed in, providing them to the FBI.
The FBI treated the report seriously enough to internally forward it for vetting against known individuals in the case.
